sentence.text: Patient 7 had medially sparse lower eyelashes, a short soft palate and small and low-set ears with a preauricular tag on the left (Fig. 1d).
She had thumb aplasia and radioulnar synostosis on the right and a rudimentary thumb on the left-hand side (Fig. 2m).
The lower extremities showed bilateral talipes and overriding fifth toes, which had resolved upon follow-up at the age of 4 years (Fig. 3c).
She suffered from conductive hearing loss.
